title: Survey Protocol
description: Describes the survey data, data collection methods, and application configuration for the NPS iPad Park Observer application.

meta-name.description: The schema used by the protocol file.

meta-version.description: The version of the schema used by the protocol file.

version.description: The version of this named protocol.

date.description: The publication date of the protocol file.

tracklogs.description: Determines if tracklogs are required, optional, or not wanted.

transects.description: Determines if being on-transect (observing) is required to make an observation.

transect-label.description: An optional label for the start/stop observing (transect/survey) button.

observing.description: An optional message to display on screen when observing (on transect).

notobserving.description: An optional message to display on screen when track logging (recording) but not observing (off transect).

status_message_fontsize.description: The font size for the observing/notobserving messages.

cancel_on_top.description: Should the cancel/delete button be on the top of the editing form?

gps_interval.description: The number of seconds between saving successive GPS points to the tracklog.

mission.description: An object for describing segments of the survey.

features.description: A list of objects that describe the features that will be observed.

csv.description: The format for exporting survey data to CSV files.

attributes.description: A list of the mission's attributes.

edit_at_start_recording.description: If true, the mission attributes editor will be displayed when the start recording button is pushed.

edit_at_start_first_observing.description: If true, the mission attributes editor will be displayed when the start observing button is first pushed.

edit_at_start_reobserving.description: If true, the mission attributes editor will be displayed when the start observing button is pushed after the first push.

edit_prior_at_stop_observing.description: If true, the mission attributes editor will be displayed for the start of the segment when the stop observing button is pushed.

edit_at_stop_observing.description: If true, the mission attributes editor will be displayed when the stop observing button is pushed.

dialog.description: Describes the look and feel of the mission attribute editor.

symbology.description: The graphical representation of the points when the mission properties were edited.

on-symbology.description: The graphical representation of the track log when observing (on-transect).

off-symbology.description: The graphical representation of the track log when not observing (off-transect).

gps-symbology.description: The graphical representation of the gps points along the track log.

totalizer.description: An object used to define the text summarizing the mission so far.

name.description: A short unique identifier for this feature, i.e. the item being observed.

attributes.description: A list of the feature's attributes.

locations.description: A list of the permitted techniques for specifying the location of an observation.

dialog.description: Describes the look and feel feature attribute editor.

symbology.description: The graphical representation of the feature.

allow_off_transect_observations.description: If true, then this feature can be observed while off transect (not observing).

label.description: Describes how these features should be labeled on the map.

name.description: The unique column name for the attribute (no spaces, numbers, or weird characters, only a-z, A-Z and _).

type.description: Identifies the kind of data the attribute stores (from NSAttributeType).

required.description: If true, then this attribute is required to be not null.

type.description: The kind of location method described by this location.

default.description: Designates this location method as the default method if multiple are allowed.

allow.description: Defines whether this type of location method is allowed.

deadAhead.description: The angle measurement in degrees that means the feature is dead ahead. Only used with type angleDistance.

units.description: Units of distance measurements to the feature. Only used with type angleDistance and azimuthDistance.

direction.description: Defines whether angles increase in the clockwise (cw) or counter-clockwise (ccw) direction. Only used with type angleDistance.

fields.description: The names of attributes that are 'watched'. When one of them changes, the totalizer resets.

units.description: The units for the quantities displayed in the totalizer.

includeon.description: Indicate if the total distance/time while 'observing' should be displayed.

includeoff.description: Indicate if the total distance/time while not 'observing' should be displayed.

includetotal.description: Indicate if the total distance/time regardless of 'observing' status should be displayed.

fontsize.description: The size (in points) of the font used for the totalizer text.

field.description: An attribute name (from Attributes) that will be used as the text of the label.

color.description: The color of the text as a hexidecimal triplet of red, green and blue values. `#RRGGBB`; 00 = 0 (none), FF = 255 (full).

size.description: The font size of the text; in points (1/72 of an inch).

symbol.description: An esri text symbol object, see https://developers.arcgis.com/documentation/common-data-types/symbol-objects.htm

definition.description: An esri label definition object, see https://developers.arcgis.com/web-map-specification/objects/labelingInfo/

title.description: The text (title) at the top of the editing form.

grouped.description: Determines if the sections in this form are grouped.  I.e. there is visual separation between sections.

sections.description: A list of form elements collected into a single section.

title.description: The text (title) at the top of this section.

elements.description: A list of editable form elements like text boxes and option pickers.

type.description: One of a well defined set of names for specific form elements.

key.description: A unique identifier for this form element; Not used.

bind.description: A special string that encodes the type and attribute name of the data for this element.

title.description: The name/prompt that describes the data in this form element.

items.description: A list of choices for a picklist type element (QRadioElement or QSegmentedElement).

selected.description: The zero based index of the intially selected item from the list of items.

boolValue.description: The default value for a boolean control (0 = false, 1 = true) only used by QBooleanElement.

minimumValue.description: The minimum value allowed in QIntegerElement.

maximumValue.description: The maximum value allowed in QIntegerElement.

numberValue.description: The default number value for a QIntegerElement or QDecimalElement.

placeholder.description: Sample text to put in a text box to suggest to the user what to enter.

fractionDigits.description: How many digits will be shown after the decimal point (for QDecimalElement only).

keyboardType.description: Determines what kind of keyboard will appear when text editing is required.

autocorrectionType.description: Determines if a text box will auto correct (fix spelling) the user's typing.

autocapitalizationType.description: Determines if and how a text box will auto capitalize the user's typing.

DialogElementType.description: The different kinds of form elements.
DialogElementType.title: DialogElementType

DialogElementKeyboard.description: The different choices for on screen keyboards.
DialogElementKeyboard.title: DialogElementKeyboard

DialogElementAutoCorrection.description: The different choices for fixing spelling errors.
DialogElementAutoCorrection.title: DialogElementAutoCorrection

DialogElementAutoCapitalization.description: The different choices for fixing capitalization.
DialogElementAutoCapitalization.title: DialogElementAutoCapitalization

gps_points.description: Describes how to build the GPS point feature class from the CSV file containing the GPS points.

track_logs.description: Describes how to build the track log feature class from the CSV file containing the tracklogs and mission properties.

features.description: Describes how to build the observer and feature point feature classes from the CSV file containing the observed features.

header.description: The header of the CSV file; a list of the column names in order.

feature_field_names.description: A list of the field names from the csv header that will create the observed feature tables.

feature_field_types.description: A list of the field types for each column listed in the 'feature_field_names' property.

feature_field_map.description: The column indices from the csv header, starting with zero, for the columns containing the data for the observed feature tables.

feature_key_indexes.description: The column indices, starting with zero, for the columns containing the time, x and y coordinates of the feature.

obs_name.description: The name of the table in the esri geodatabase that will contain the data for the observer of the features.

obs_field_names.description: A list of the field names from the csv header that will create the observed feature table.

obs_field_types.description: A list of the field types for each column listed in the 'obs_field_names' property.

obs_field_map.description: The column indices from the csv header, starting with zero, for the columns containing the data for the observer table.

obs_key_indexes.description: The column indices, starting with zero, for the columns containing the time, x and y coordinates of the observer.

name.description: The name of the csv file, and the table in the esri geodatabase.

field_names.description: A list of the field names in the header of the CSV file in order.

field_types.description: A list of the field types in the columns of the CSV file in order.

key_indexes.description: The column indices, starting with zero, for the columns containing the time, x and y coordinates of the point.

name.description: The name of the csv file, and the table in the esri geodatabase.

field_names.description: A list of the field names in the header of the CSV file in order.

field_types.description: A list of the field types in the columns of the CSV file in order.

start_key_indexes.description: The column indices, starting with zero, for the columns containing the time, x and y coordinates of the first point in the tracklog.

end_key_indexes.description: The column indices, starting with zero, for the columns containing the time, x and y coordinates of the last point in the tracklog.

CsvFieldType.description: Describes the data type for a column in the CSV.  Corresponds to parameter values in the esri create geodatabase table tool
CsvFieldType.title: CsvFieldType
